parse.title: Zombie hand
parse.text:
This article is about the monster. For the emote, see Zombie Hand (emote).
Zombie hand

Zombie hands only appear in Meiyerditch Dungeon. They can be killed instead of Crawling Hands or Zombies for Slayer tasks, to gain more experience and better drops. Meiyerditch Dungeon can only be accessed during and after the Legacy of Seergaze quest. Skeletal hands, which are in the same area as zombie hands, will occasionally drop from the ceiling or come up from the ground and attack players.

Zombie hands have very low defence, so players wearing a Salve amulet or Salve amulet (e) can kill them faster than Experiments in Experiment Cave. This makes them one of the best ways in training combat. In contrast, however, their max hit is 216 (although it is rare for them to hit over 80), so food or Protect from Melee will prove useful if things turn sour.

A Dwarf Cannon used in tandem with Chinchompas or Burst spells can make short work of a slayer assignment. However, this is an expensive approach, and the drops barely make up for the cost of prayer potions, runes, and/or ammunition consumed.

Players should use a Mask of Broken Fingers (or its helm variant Helm of the Dead Hand) to kill these, especially when on a slayer assignment, to take advantage of its benefits.

Players can obtain a soul of a crawling hand for the Slayer Codex from this creature when using an ushabti.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Meiyerditch Dungeon69None6Maplink

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • For players who have completed The Branches of Darkmeyer, Drakan's medallion can teleport them to the Meiyerditch labs which connects to the dungeon.
  • Using the wicked hood's teleport to the blood altar.
  • Travelling to the Abyss, then to the Blood altar and exiting the altar is a quick way to them. To avoid prayer drain, wear a forinthry bracelet or use prayer potions.
  • Players with level 65 Agility (this can be boosted) can use an Agility shortcut behind Ivandis Seergaze's tomb.
  • Using blood altar Runecrafting Teleport Tablets is faster than using the Abyss and does not drain prayer, and can be obtained as a reward from the Great Orb Project activity.
  • The Mask of Broken Fingers or its upgraded version can teleport players directly to the dungeon twice per day.

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Updated Undead Slayer categories gamewide.
  • update 22 April 2008 (Update):
    • Added to game.
